verses.roman:
sannikarṣo 'tra martyānām
anādaraṇa-kāraṇam
gāṅgaṁ hitvā yathānyāmbhas
tatratyo yāti śuddhaye

synonyms: sannikarṣaḥ—proximity; atra—here (in this world); martyānām—for mortals; anādaraṇa—of disregard; kāraṇam—a cause; gāṅgam—(the water) of the Ganges; hitvā—leaving; yathā—as; anya—other; ambhaḥ—to water; tatratyaḥ—one who lives near it; yāti—goes; śuddhaye—for purification.
translation: In this world familiarity breeds contempt. For example, one who lives on the banks of the Ganges might travel to some other body of water to be purified.
